lines.text:
[to the wolf dressed as grandma]
Hey, Grandma! That's an awfully big nose for you... TO HAVE!

[as Red Riding Hood interrupts him at the end]
I'll do it, but I'll probably hate myself in the morning!
[Replaces the Wolf with Red Riding Hood over a shovel of coal with heavy things piled on top]
Hey, Granma! I brought a little bunny rabbit for you - ta HAVE!

[riding in Red Riding Hood's basket]
Eh, whatcha got in the basket, gorgeous?
I've got a little bunny rabbit I'm taking to my grandma's, to have, see?
Hmm. Well, not a bad pair of stems for a rabbit.
Yeah, and he's got a cute face, too. See?
[Pulls Bugs out to show him his own face]

[to the other wolves in Grandma's bed]
Come on, come on! Take a powder. This is my racket.

[singing]
The five o'clock whistle's on the blink/ the whistle won't blow and waaadaya think?/ my poppa's still in the factory/ 'cause he don't know what tiiiiiiiiiime it happens to be!
